column5: Hello folks, once again I am turning to this site for some help, due to my health I am looking at buying some land around the Flesherton area that will have to be cleared and then build on, but what I would like to do is put up a bunkie so that I have a place to stay temporally while we build.  I have not started my search yet, it does not necessarily have to be a " Bunkie " I just want something to come up to and be able to stay in.  The possibility of looking at a trailer is also an option but that would be my second choice as I would like to re use after the initial  use is completed.  What suggestions do you have of locating said " Bunkie " in the Flesherton / Markdale area?  Thanks in advance,   FLEX
Many people use a wooden shed as a bunkie
Thanks for the suggestion jjcanoe, I need to be able to stay in it so a wooden shed will not cut it.  FLEX
Yes, this.  A wooden shed, can be made into a house.....just sayin.  S.
Many people buy used portable classrooms for bunnies cottages or hunt camp Google government surplus auction for great deals on them when they come up

Made a "bunky" for me on my dad's property in a few days of non stop work vs paying someone else to do it was what I did.  I get you may not have the time to do so hence why asking where to buy so if no time to do so, buy a pop up camper so it can be used for the future too.
I picked up this used trailer at a petty good price. It is completely self contained,hot & cold running water,satelite tv & is hooked up to my septic
When dad and I built a house we stayed in an 8 x 10 bunkie, complete with coleman stove and the thunder pole..outside.  It was later moved and served as a garden shed.

Echo the used trailer thoughts.  But then... I picked up this used trailer at a petty good price. It is completely self contained,hot & cold running water,satelite tv & is hooked up to my septic  Nice Pickaroon!  Cheers, Mark
Thanks for the suggestions, all are appreciated.  FLEX
http://www.ecolog-homes.com/ezlog/small-cabins/bunkie these arenot to pricey and my friend loves his
